title: 107_s1134
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" and includes modifications applicable to qualified small business stock. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986:
- Repeal of Minimum Tax Preference by striking paragraph (7) in subsection (a) of section 57.
- Increase in Rollover Period for Qualified Small Business Stock from 60-day to 180-day in section 1045.
- Reduction in Holding Period for gains from certain small business stock from 5 years to 3 years in section 1202. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, such as repealing the per-issuer limitation on taxpayer's eligible gain and modifying the qualified trade or business section. Additionally, the working capital limitation is repealed, and exceptions are made for certain purchases by corporations of their own stock. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by increasing the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock to 100 percent. It also includes provisions for disregarding stock purchases by corporations if a business purpose is established. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Code. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by increasing the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock to 100 percent. It includes provisions for disregarding stock purchases by corporations if a business purpose is established. Amendments are made to various sections of the Code, such as redesignating paragraphs and changing headings. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" increases the exclusion for gain from small business stock to 100 percent. Stock held by members of a controlled group is not eligible. The asset limitation for larger businesses is raised to $300,000,000 with an inflation adjustment. The exclusion for gain from small business stock is increased to 100 percent under the "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001." The amendments apply to stock issued after the enactment of the Act.
